abstract: Investors and analysts have urged a breakup of Citigroup, saying the company has become too unwieldy to be managed effectively.
snippet: Investors and analysts have urged a breakup of Citigroup, saying the company has become too unwieldy to be managed effectively.
lead_paragraph: Sanford I. Weill built Citigroup into one of the world’s largest banking companies. Now, Vikram S. Pandit is watching Mr. Weill’s creation wither in the stock market.

headline.main: Assurances From Citigroup, but Skepticism on Wall Street
headline.print_headline: Assurances From Citigroup, But Skepticism on Wall Street
